channel.title: briefUpdatesMainNLbusinessAndMarkets
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from briefUpdatesMainNLbusinessAndMarkets, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: The Fed’s Own Economists Disagree Where the Economy Is Heading
item.description: The Fed cut rates, but there’s no consensus on what comes next for policy.

item.title: FCC chief considers charging Kimmel, ABC with spreading misinformation over jokes, remarks about the ideology of Charlie Kirk assassin
item.description: “We’re reinvigorating the FCC’s enforcement of the public interest,” Brendan Carr said on CNBC, “and I think that’s a good thing.”

item.title: What the Internet Got Wrong About That Viral Gap-Katseye Ad
item.description: We asked the marketing agency behind Gap’s ‘Better in Denim’ campaign—featuring Katseye—about that American Eagle ad.

item.title: $34 billion was wiped from Larry Ellison’s net worth days after briefly becoming the world’s richest as ‘AI bubble’ fears grow
item.description: Larry Ellison briefly knocked Tesla CEO Elon Musk from the top spot last week, but he’s lost billions in the one week since.

item.title: 3 Branding Moves Every Service Business Needs to Scale Without Losing Its Soul
item.description: Growth can kill a brand faster than competition. Here’s how to do it the right way.

item.title: ‘Lots of gasps and dropped jaws’: Stephen Colbert learned of Jimmy Kimmel’s suspension while taping his own canceled CBS show
item.description: President Trump called it “Great News for America: The ratings challenged Jimmy Kimmel Show is CANCELLED." (The show was suspended, not cancelled.)

item.title: The 10 best countries to retire in right now—and America didn’t make the cut
item.description: As retiring in America becomes increasingly unaffordable, retirees are booking a one-way trip to Portugal instead.

item.title: Why Nvidia Just Invested $5 Billion in Its Competitor, Intel
item.description: Nvidia and Intel will team up to work on data centers that form the backbone of AI infrastructure as well as personal computer products.

item.title: Disgruntled Starbucks workers in 3 states sue over dress-code changes, saying the company refused to reimburse them
item.description: “As part of this change, and to ensure out partners were prepared, partners received two shirts at no cost,” Starbucks said about its workers.

item.title: Hailee Steinfeld’s new margarita brand shows that canned cocktails are the next hot celebrity beverage
item.description: Over the past few years, celebrity-backed liquor brands have enjoyed an undeniable cultural moment —and tequila is currently the hottest drink in the ...

item.title: Preparing for Tomorrow: Inc. 5000 CEOs on AI, Culture, and Adaptability
item.description: The conversation reveals how today’s top business leaders are laser-focused on workplace culture, adaptability, and the integration of generative AI.

item.title: Alphabet’s Waymo enters partnership with Via to offer robotaxis starting in this state
item.description: Alphabet’s Waymo will offer its autonomous rides on Via Transportation’s public transit platform, starting with Chandler city in Arizona, the companie...

item.title: The Fed’s decision on its benchmark interest rate shows unity against Trump’s attacks
item.description: The Federal Reserve’s nearly unanimous decision Wednesday to reduce its key interest rate was seen by many observers as a quiet show of unity and inde...

item.title: Nvidia announces $5 billion investment in Intel, making it one of its biggest shareholders
item.description: Nvidia said on Thursday it would invest $5 billion in Intel , throwing its heft behind the struggling U.S. chipmaker just weeks after the White House ...

item.title: Feeling self-doubt at work? Here are 3 steps to reframe those negative thoughts
item.description: When we make mistakes at work, it can lead to a cycle of negative thinking . The damaging thoughts swirl : “I’m an impostor.” “I’m not smart enough.” ...
